item.value: The world's shortest alphabet, used in the Solomon Islands, has only 11.
The shortest person in the world is Khagendra Thapa Maga. He is 56 cm ( 22 in ) tall. The shortest woman was Pauline Muster. She was 58 cm ( 23 in ) tall.
The world's population grows by over 100 million each year.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
The banana tree is not actually a tree, it is a herb. It bears fruit once a year and then dies.
Electric eels can stun both predators and prey with electric shocks of around 500 volts.
English is the second most spoken language in the world.
John Logie Baird was the inventor of the world's first working television system in Hastings, England in 1923.
Sneezing with your eyes open is impossible
A sneeze generates a wind of 166 km/hr (100 mi/hr), and a cough moves out at 100 km/hr (60 mi/hr).
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
Alaska is the largest state in America.
In 1783 Jean Pilatre de Rozier ( a Frenchman ) made the first balloon flight, reaching a peak altitude of about 500 ft, and traveling about 51/2 mi in 20 min.
The shortfin Mako shark is the fastest fish.
The earth is the 3rd planet from the sun and is the 5th largest planet in our solar system. Jupiter is the largest planet.
The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It is about 38 million kilometers away. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
In 1783 Sebastien Lenormand was first to demonstrate the parachute. In Missouri 1912, Captain Berry was the first to jump from a plane with a parachute.
